Tucson reels in pain, and then realizes that Nightlight is not responding t=
o his call.  She was unconcious.  Again, with every effort he tries to make=
, his actions once again put a major strain on his systems as his energy le=
vels drop from sixty to forty percent.  This wouldn't bode well for him.  H=
e could no longer transform, he could no longer move without great effort. =
 He collapses to the ground, and now hearing Scorponok's steps, he remains =
up against a wall, burnt out, nearly broken, and severely drained of his re=
sources. His shinny silver armor scuffed and dented, appearing like somethi=
ng out of a major car wreck.  He could not go any further.  

Rat Trap stan=
ds over him and stays by his side.

"Wheels, no, ya can't give up on me, no=
t like this."

Tucson puts his hand with effort into Rat Traps'.

"I - may =
not be - able to move, but, you - still have all your energy reserves - in =
tact.  Rat - Trap. I - need you to - f- find the others, Zarak mentoned the=
 Ark..  You - must find it and - try to get help.  Can - you do that?"

Rat=
 Trap nodds.

" I hate leavn' ya here Wheels, but we're outa options.  Okay=
, I'll do it.  For you I'll risk my aft.  But, how do I find it? When will =
I know I've reached it?"

Tucson gasps for breath.  He then takes off his t=
ransmitter from his helmet and turns on a beacon.  The beacon pulses slowly=
 on it.  

" There is a beacon on this transmitter.  The faster it - pulsat=
es, the closser you - are to finding the Ark. It  was installed on my helme=
t after I became visually impaired, so I could find my way back to the Ark =
after - each mission.  The beacon reacts to the alloys used to build the sh=
ip.  And  only ones used by Autobots.  

Rat Trap takes the transmitter.

"=
But without this you're a sittn' duck. This is our ears, this is how you na=
vigate.  Without this, you'll be bumpn' the walls constantly."

Tucson sigh=
s.

" I  can't  go anywhere anyway.  Now, get - going. You  have  a lot of =
ground to cover."

Rat Trap nodds, while Tucson secures the transmitter ont=
o his left ear, while in his rat form.  The transmitter seems rather large =
for his ear yet, he carries it sufficiantly.

" You can count on me Wheels.=
"

He leaves his disabled friend, and darts out into the hallways in his ra=
t form, cautiously moving and freezing in place once in open areas.  The tr=
ansmitter blips slowly.  He still had a long way to go before he could reac=
h the Ark.





--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclon=
us@...> wrote:
>
> For the briefest of moments Zarak caught a glimpse of th=
e reading on
> his scanner, and all he  could see immediately that what was=
 hidden in
> Tuscon's helm was no simple rat, there was too much energy the=
re.
> 
> However the rat quickly transferred energy to Tuscon in the form o=
f a
> fuel dump, and quicker than Zarak would have thought possible Tuscon
=
> was back in action, along with Rat Trap!
> 
> It seemed like it only took=
 seconds! Rat Trap appeared, Tuscon
> revived, Darkhawk was knocked down, a=
nd for a moment it seemed as if
> Tuscon was going to drive right over him,=
 but then he swerved, and
> after a blast from Rat Trap that blasted open a=
 section of wall they
> took off down.
> 
> Zarak smiled as he sent a few s=
hots from his energy rifle down after
> the fleeing Autobot and Maximal!
> =

> Quickly he leaped over to where the fallen Darkhawk lay as he opened a
>=
 communication to Hydras and Perceptor, "The prisoner has escaped!"
> Zarak=
 looked back over at the hole that was blown in the door as he
> spoke, "Th=
ere were two of them. One of them was hiding on that Tuscon
> Autobot. He s=
omehow freed him and they're driving through the base!"
> 
> Even as Zarak =
did quick scan of Darkhawk to check his vitals, a deep
> thunk of metal boo=
ts hitting thick deck plating could be heard from
> behind him. A door slid=
 open.
> 
> After ascertaining that Darkhawk would live he stood and turned=
, "Yes
> my old friend, the time has come once again."
> 
> Taking up the e=
ntire frame of the door was the massive figure of
> Scorponok, Zarak's seco=
nd body so to speak. At the moment it was
> headless, giving it a strangely=
 ghastly and yet vulnerable appearance.
> However that was easily rectified=
 as Zarak leaped into the air and
> with the tel-tale sounds of gears grind=
ing he shifted into a head, one
> that slipped perfectly between Scorponok'=
s shoulders and clicked.
> 
> In his own form Zarak was short, even diminut=
ive, but now joined once
> again with Scorponok he was fully head and shoul=
ders taller then most
> Maximals and Predicons! With a Decepticon purple fr=
ame and powerfully
> built green limbs he radiated aggression and domminanc=
e! The cannons
> mounted on his shoulders and the massive claws that he had=
 for hands
> were mute testimony to the true destructive potential that lay=
 at his
> command.
> 
> He transformed into his destructive crab mode and t=
ook off after Rat
> Trap and Tuscon!
> 
> OOC: I think that Cyclonus and Sc=
ourge and the rest are somewhat
> separate from all this for them not to be=
 involved, so I will post for
